title_en: The Valencian government announces that it will cancel the agreement to hire 5,000 teachers the day after the educational strike
summary_en:
The Valencian government is canceling an agreement to hire 5,000 teachers after an educational strike.
The Ministry of Education claims that the agreement lacked the necessary controls and impact and budget reports.
The decision to cancel the agreement was made after analyzing the agreement and verifying its lack of necessary controls.
The Bar of the Generalitat concluded that the agreement has no legal force.
The Regional Minister of Education explains that the current ministry is forced to abandon the agreement to ensure legal certainty for teachers.
The decision affects the programming of investment policy in the field of education, which in its significance and scale exceeds what a regular office should take into account.
The unions interpret this move as an attempt to reduce the number of teachers.
The Ministry proposes a timetable for negotiations on a new education agreement.
The political opposition accuses Education of a repeated attack on education with staff cuts.

title: –ó–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∞ –∞–≤–∏–∞–¥–∏—Å–ø–µ—Ç—á–µ—Ä–æ–≤ –ø–∞—Ä–∏–∂—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞ –û—Ä–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ–ª–∞ –∫ –º–∞—Å—Å–æ–≤–æ–π –æ—Ç–º–µ–Ω–µ —Ä–µ–π—Å–æ–≤ –≤ –≤—ã—Ö–æ–¥–Ω—ã–µ
title_en: A strike by air traffic controllers at Paris Orly Airport led to massive flight cancellations over the weekend
summary_en:
A strike by air traffic controllers at Paris' Orly Airport led to massive flight cancellations over the weekend.
The Civil Aviation Authority has ordered airlines to cancel 70% of flights due to the strike.
Cancellations will affect commercial flights from 04:00 GMT on Saturday until late Sunday evening.
The strike began due to the airport's preparations for a massive influx of passengers in connection with the Olympic Games in Paris.
This is the second major strike by air traffic controllers in a month, which has led to the cancellation of thousands of flights across Europe.
The second largest trade union body, UNSA-ICNA, demanded staff reductions, claiming insufficient staff.
The government condemned the strike, and the Deputy Minister of Transport expressed regret for the behavior of some agents.
Orly is the second largest airport in the capital after Roissy-Charles de Gaulle and the hub of the national airline Air France.
